item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Use the Partners Event Spin Glitch
item.description:
If you’re a dedicated Monopoly GO player grinding through the Partner Events, you’ll know how precious those event tokens can be. In the latest iteration of the Partner Event, Jedi Partners, a clever spin glitch has surfaced that lets players maximize their rewards without spending any event tokens. This guide explains how you can take full advantage of this spin hack before it gets patched.

The glitch described in this article can be patched at any time by Scopely , and there is no guarantee it will work for everyone. Also, using glitches like this can go against the game’s rules, which means your account could get flagged, suspended, or even banned. While it worked for us and many others, there’s still a risk, so proceed with caution.

What Is The Partners Event Spin Hack?

This glitch takes advantage of how spin results are processed in the special Partner Spin Wheel in Monopoly GO . The wheel is divided into different segments, each awarding a certain number of points. These points contribute to the progress bar for that specific attraction.

Typically, when you spin the wheel, you use your gold bar tokens to try and land on the high-value slots, like the Mega Spin. Now, if you do manage to secure a Mega Spin , this trick lets you lock it in and then increase your reward by manipulating the spin multiplier right before the actual spin occurs.

The idea is that by doing so, if the wheel lands on the Mega Spin, the increased multiplier will significantly amplify the reward you receive, turning a regular jackpot into a much larger payout that can help you complete your partner build faster.

How To Use The Partners Event Spin Glitch in Monopoly GO

Here’s a step-by-step guide to help you use the Partners Event Spin Glitch and hit milestones in the Jedi Partners quicker:

  1. Open up any of your partner builds and begin spinning using the base 20 gold bars per spin (at 1x multiplier).
  2. Keep spinning until the wheel stops at the Mega Spin.
  3. As soon as you land on the Mega Spin, exit the spin screen immediately.
  4. Next, reopen your partner build. This time, set your spin multiplier to 30x (or the highest you can afford).
  5. With the Mega Spin still open, spin again. You'll now receive a huge surge in points or progress, as the game applies the 30x multiplier to your reward, all without using up any more of your valuable event tokens.

item.title: Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon - How to find Lake of Blood Secret Dungeon
item.description:
In Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon , players can find a lot of ominous things in its Dark Fantasy setting, and one of these things is a huge lake filled with blood that is displayed as a welcoming mat for the players' first setting foot in Avalon. However, the lake itself holds an even more gruesome secret, which will have players delving into a hidden dungeon and slaying a powerful boss.

Players are advised to prepare properly before trying this, as it is one of the hardest bosses in the early game, and unfit for level 2-3 players that have just landed after the shipwreck. Now, let's start by locating the secret Blood Lake dungeon .

Warning. The following guide contains spoilers for the 'Blood Stains the Circle' quest. Readers are advised to proceed with caution.

How To Find Secret Blood Lake Dungeon In Tainted Grail: The Fall Of Avalon

To find the secret Blood Lake Dungeon in Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon players need to follow the path from the starting point on the beach, and then turn slightly to the left, (The other path leads to yet another dungeon named 'Miner's Tunnels,' but players should look in the opposite direction to find the Blood Lake), then continue west and look around for a body of water with a big statue in the middle.

Turn to the statue and walk towards the small beach, and the Lake will soon reveal a bloody scene of carnage. Deal with the Undead swarming around the corpses, and if players have a shovel , they can dig out a chest containing some loot. If they swim to the statue and pray to it, they will receive the Blood Transfusion spell.

Now, swim across the sticky red liquid, then dive behind the statue and continue to stick to the bottom and head towards the ruins that reveal a small opening. There's a door there, cross it to enter the secret dungeon . The second players enter this new instance they will receive a new quest: ' Blood Stains the Circle .'

Players should be around level 10-12 to try this dungeon in the Normal difficulty, or around level 8 in Easy (Adventure) mode. Needless to say, difficulty levels beyond Normal (Survival, Hardcore, etc.) will require an extreme level of skill to beat.

How to Beat Mallory: The Last Man

Mallory is the first mini-boss players will find in this bizarre-looking cave, and if they approach and talk to him for a bit, they can make a few checks using Strength or Spirituality to dig out more information about what awaits beyond the gates he is guarding, and this will progress the Blood Stains the Circle quest. Be it as it may, this will end with a fight, where Mallory will compel the players to try and slay him as part of some wicked ritual.

Once the battle starts, stick to the walls of the room, and attract the boss to make him circle around the debris and candlesticks that will serve as a barrier for his attacks. For ranged players, they can use this as a way to cheese him into submission with ease. Melee players will have it a little tougher, but they can do a similar thing by circling around and waiting for him to drop his three-swing combo, then hitting Mallory with everything they've got to make him exhausted.

Once players defeat Mallory, they can loot the body for some interesting loot, like the Sword of Parrying +1 , the Chestplate of the Last Man , a Cracked Shield +2 , and the Face of the Last Man , which are some decent items for a warrior who is just starting their adventure.

Exploring the Antechamber

The door of the dungeon will open, and players can now enter an antechamber with a tree growing in the center. There's a lot of interesting loot here that is going to be detailed next. Make sure to grab all this since it will be extremely useful later during the adventure:

  1. Go past the Three and the Withered Druid lamenting on the floor, climb the stairs, turn your attention to the Alchemy table to pick up a Soulstone and a Druid's Wishgem , two amulets that have a lot of utility.
  2. Following the circular structure that surrounds the tree growing in the middle, players can also loot several useful Alchemy reagents and a book containing the recipes for potions, which include Druid's Friend , and Bloodsucker Potion .
  3. Now, descend once more to the tree level and look around for the glowing ore in the center of the room. Mine it to obtain Wyrdstone, a rare component for crafting end-game items.

Once players are finished with this room, the next thing to do is to search around the glowing tree's roots for a passage that leads into a maze-like zone. Players will explore this area next, and they should be extremely careful with the enemies that lie there.

To avoid losing progress, players should go to the Game tab in the option menu, then go to 'Auto Save Frequency' and set it as low as possible (3 minutes is recommended, but players can set it to 1 minute if they want to). That way, they won't need to restart all over if they die mid-exploration.

How To Find Prydwen in Blood Stains The Circle

The next area of this hidden dungeon will be a maze called Hall of Trials, which is affected by the Wyrdness and filled to the brim with undead druids and monsters. Luckily, the druids won't be aggressive (unless players attack them), so their attention should be focused on the many creatures hidden there.

The most notorious one will be the Marrowghast, which can rush and attack at melee range or shoot projectiles that cause poisoning, and the Wyrdspirits, which are extremely hard to target. So be careful not to be overrun by these creatures. The image below is an overlook of the maze.

It is highly recommended that players equip the Soulstone here and start charging it by killing the enemies inside the Hall of Trials. Once its fully charged, they should keep it equipped to face the final boss of this dungeon.

To the northern left corner lies an NPC named Prydwen , the leader of the druids and the one players should talk to to proceed further into the dungeon. To the right side, there's a chest tucked into a corner, guarded by a Marrowghast and a Wyrdspirit, that holds the useful ' Hexbounce Wand ,' a unique magic weapon that can block projectiles (including arrows and spells) and throw them back at the attacker.

When players are done exploring the area, they should talk to Prydwen, and the druid will tell them that the Abomination they have created lies hidden in a sealed chamber. He will grant them a seal to activate the blood-gemstone door. Players should ready themselves for the true boss of this dungeon: The Blood Abomination.

How To Beat The Blood Abomination

Open the sealed doo r in the Halls of Trials to descend into yet another blood pool , and after a cutscene, the Blood Abomination will emerge from the depths of this crimson goo. Now players need to fight with everything they have, and here's the fastest way to defeat this boss:

  • Rush as close as possible and ignore the summoned creature the boss calls at the start of the fight.
  • Use King's Soul to slow down time and target the Abomination until its stamina bar drains to deal a finisher.
  • Ranged players can do the same from a safe distance, but once the King's Soul effect ends, they will be exposed to the attacks of the summon and the Abomination.
  • Use Charged Spells in quick succession to deal as much damage as possible. Using the Burning Embers charged spell will do the trick.

If players equipped have the Soulstone equipped and charged, they will save themselves from death at least one time, which will grant them an extra chance to deal even more damage to the Abomination and slay it once and for all.

Once defeated, loot the boss's corpse to get the Cursed Bloodblade , a one-handed sword that increases life steal by 2%, and proceed further inside the chamber to find a chest with a few extra things like potions and crafting materials. The room below is the entrance to the dungeon, so don't drop. Instead, turn back and go back to report to Prydwen, to finish the quest and receive the final rewards .

How To Complete Blood Stains The Circle In Tainted Grail The Fall Of Avalon

Talking to Prydwen will give players the extra part of the lore missing about the sinister experiment going on in the druid circle, and finish the Blood Stains the Circle quest, rewarding them with the Winged Spear.

This weapon increases damage by a whopping 100% when players are below 50% mana. A useful item for a druid summoner build, since it will use up to 50% mana to summon creatures, then receive the buff of the spear to attack at melee range while the summons swarm foes. It is a pretty decent build that will take players a long way before they need to switch to a more specialized build.

Once Prydwen thanks the players with some juicy rewards, he will immediately pass away. The remaining 'undead' druids will remain neutral, so don't worry too much about them. Still, players should take note of what happened inside this secret Blood Lake dungeon, since it has ties to the main storyline of Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon , and it will help them make an important choice further ahead in the adventure.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Halo Infinite's Sequel May End Up Having The Perfect Reveal Date
item.description:
As of May 2025, the future of the Halo franchise is a little unclear. Halo Infinite is still being updated regularly, with its latest update landing at the start of May, but there's still no concrete news on the franchise's next mainline installment or any other Halo projects that are currently in development.

Back in October 2024, 343 Industries renamed itself to Halo Studios. This rebrand came alongside the announcement that all future Halo video game projects would be using Unreal Engine 5, as opposed to the franchise's aging Slipspace Engine. Fans were treated to a few glimpses of an internal test build called Project Foundry, which was explicitly stated to not be a new game. It was said, however, that elements seen in the footage would appear in future Halo games. And while there's still no word on what these games are or when they'll appear, there's a perfect reveal date waiting in the wings.

Related
The Arbiter from Halo deserves his own game

Arbiter is one of the most interesting characters in the franchise. He offers a compelling perspective of the Covenant and the galaxy as a whole. His story of redemption, honor, and struggle against his own people offers a richness of emotion that is largely missing in the Spartan-focused games. A game based on the Arbiter would open doors to previously untapped lore, offer a new type of gameplay (Similar to what may have been seen in Halo 2), and give fans a new, darker aspect of Halo to become involved in, which is something the franchise desperately needs.

2026 Would Be The Perfect Time for Halo to Make Some Announcements

2026 Marks Halo's 25th Anniversary

On November 15, 2001, Halo: Combat Evolved hit Xbox consoles for the very first time. This means that on November 15, 2026, Halo: Combat Evolved – and the Halo franchise as a whole – will celebrate its 25th anniversary.

The Halo franchise has changed a lot in the last 25 years. Bungie has long since stepped away from the franchise it created, and 343 Industries has done its best to uphold the series' lofty legacy while pushing it forward into new territory. This journey hasn't always been a smooth one, but the good arguably outweighs the bad. And with Halo Studios now looking to embark on a new phase of the franchise, Halo 's 25th anniversary would be the ideal time to announce some new projects.

First up should be the heavily rumored Halo: Combat Evolved remake/remaster. Reports of this rumored Halo remaster or remake originally surfaced in June 2024, with The Verge's Tom Warren claiming that Microsoft had a Halo remaster in development and that it was being considered for release on "rival consoles." A ground-up remake of Halo: Combat Evolved in Unreal Engine 5 would be a great way for Halo Studios to get fans onboard with its future plans, and it'd be the perfect way to celebrate the original entry's 25th anniversary.

Halo's 25th Anniversary Should Only Be The Beginning

But a remake or remaster of Halo: Combat Evolved should only be the tip of the iceberg of Halo Studios' 25th anniversary plans. According to Halo Studios' Xbox Wire announcement back in October 2024, "multiple new games using [Unreal Engine 5] are in development," and it'd be great if fans were given a closer look at some of these projects next November.

For years, fans have been asking for more diverse Halo video game projects, such as experimental spinoffs that expand on the Halo franchise's lore and gameplay opportunities. Halo: Combat Evolved 's 25th anniversary could be the perfect moment for Halo Studios to reinvigorate the franchise with a slew of new game announcements that finally deliver on these desires.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Cerydra First Kit Details
item.description:
Summary

  • According to a leak, Cerydra is a new five-star character in Honkai: Star Rail with high energy costs for powerful buffs.
  • She is a support character with a kit that includes an ultimate buff and energy regeneration ability.
  • Fans are concerned about potential synergy dependency between Cerydra and Phainon, similar to past issues in other games.

A new Honkai: Star Rail leak has revealed the first details about an upcoming five-star character named Cerydra. Since its release in 2023, Honkai: Star Rail has been steadily expanding its playable roster, with approximately two characters added in each update. However, the upcoming Version 3.4 will be an exception, as HoYoverse has confirmed the arrival of three new playable units.

The first banner cycle will feature the fan-favorite Phainon, who will be joined by a rerun character. A few days after Phainon's debut, HoYoverse will also introduce two additional characters, Archer and Saber, as part of a collaboration between Honkai: Star Rail and the Fate/Stay Night franchise.

Although Phainon's release is still a month away, new leaks have already begun hinting at another upcoming playable unit expected to arrive in the following months. The new character is Cerydra, who has already been mentioned in the main storyline. She has been described as a "chess piece biding its time" and is known as the one who united Honkai: Star Rail 's Chrysos Heirs, a powerful group that rose after the fall of the Amphoreus Titans. Cerydra is said to have laid the foundation for the prosperity that the city of Okhema enjoys to this day. However, after the Flame-Chasing Army suffered a harsh defeat, Cerydra’s demeanor changed and she slowly disappeared from public view. A new post on the Honkai: Star Rail subreddit has revealed the first details about her kit, suggesting that she is set to return.

Honkai: Star Rail – Cerydra Kit Leaks Explained

  • Ultimate: Cerydra grants a powerful one-turn buff to an ally and their Honkai: Star Rail memosprite. The effect is said to come with a high energy cost.
  • Talent: Increases the first ally’s Speed by 30%. The leak did not clarify whether the buff scales with base or total Speed.
  • Light Cone: Regenerates energy at the start of battle and boosts Cerydra’s own energy regeneration.

Based on these leaks, it seems likely that Cerydra will be a support character in Honkai: Star Rail . One part of the leak described her as the “after-sales service” for Phainon, implying strong synergy with the popular DPS unit. However, fans have expressed concerns about her high energy demands and speculate that in order to make her ultimate viable, players may need to obtain her signature Light Cone.

Many fans are not entirely pleased with the leak’s suggestion that Phainon and Cerydra will be overly reliant on each other. Some have even compared the situation to a similar issue in Genshin Impact , where players were frustrated by the synergy dependency between Skirk and Escoffier, characters of similarly high popularity levels as Honkai: Star Rail 's Phainon.

Board the Astral Express and roam the universe in search of myths and legends. From global interactive entertainment brand HoYoverse comes a new space fantasy RPG. Harness the spirirt of the Trailblaze in a cel-shaded space fantasy adventure where you'll embark on an unforgettable intergalactic odyssey. You and your fellow Astral Express passengers will hop from world to world, resolve conflicts, form friendships and uncover a wealth of mysteries. In this exciting new free-to-play game, you'll journey through immense worlds of the unknown and bond with a series of memorable characters. Choose your companions and arrange the ultimate four-person combat team to help you take down a looming threat to the universe.

item.title: Rumor: Apple Preparing a Gaming Push for 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Apple acquired Sneaky Sasquatch creator RAC7, marking its first-ever game developer acquisition.
  • The company is reportedly planning to launch a new gaming hub app to replace Game Center, which will be announced at WWDC 2025 on June 9.
  • Apple’s recent gaming initiatives build on a years-long effort to expand its presence in the gaming industry.

Apple has completed its first-ever game developer acquisition and reportedly plans to launch a dedicated gaming app before the end of 2025. Together, these moves could mark the company’s most significant gaming push in years, though their chances of making Apple devices significantly more appealing to gamers remain unclear—if not doubtful.

For decades, Apple products weren't built with gamers in mind. The reasons for that are multifold, and tend to vary across product categories. Mac hardware, for example, long prioritized battery life, thermal efficiency, and creative workflows, leaving gaming as little more than an afterthought. On mobile, while the iOS App Store became highly lucrative for casual titles, console-quality experiences struggled to gain traction. Developing such games was—and remains—challenging due to Apple’s software ecosystem, which requires continuous app maintenance to accommodate frequent, breaking changes in iOS updates. More recently, however, Apple has made some progress toward catering to gamers and game developers alike.

This trend may now continue with a dedicated gaming app that Apple is planning to launch in the coming months, according to a new Bloomberg report citing sources familiar with the tech giant's plans. The app, whose name remains unknown, is said to have been envisioned as a gaming hub for most modern Apple devices, including the Mac, iPhone, iPad, and Apple TV.

Apple's Gaming Hub Announcement Reportedly Coming Close to Switch 2 Launch

Bloomberg's sources claim that the new gaming hub will be revealed during Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference, whose 2025 edition is scheduled for June 9, four days following the Switch 2 launch. The app will reportedly serve as an interface for browsing the iOS App Store's game section and promote the Apple Arcade subscription service. It's also expected to replace Game Center, a social gaming platform and achievement system originally launched in 2010. Game Center started out as a dedicated app but was relegated to a Settings section in September 2016.

Apple Acquired Its First Game Developer

Separately, Digital Trends recently broke the story of Apple acquiring Canadian developer RAC7, the two-person studio behind Sneaky Sasquatch —widely touted as one of the best Apple Arcade launch games. The acquisition marks Apple’s first-ever purchase of a game developer. A company spokesperson said the move does not necessarily indicate a major strategic shift, but rather reflects a unique opportunity to expand the Apple Arcade catalog.

Apple's Gaming Focus Is on the Rise

While Apple may not be planning a game developer shopping spree anytime soon, its focus on gaming appears to be increasing. In addition to Apple Arcade, recent history saw the company introduce its Game Porting Toolkit in 2023, enabling developers to more easily adapt Windows games for modern Macs. The group has also been incentivizing ports of AAA titles for iOS and macOS, contributing to the arrival of games such as Assassin’s Creed Mirage and the Resident Evil 4 remake on Apple platforms.
